title: Scientists Make a Tiny Light Trap for Better Sensors
summary: Scientists at CU Boulder have created a tiny device called a microresonator that traps light on a chip. This device is like a small loop where light goes around and gets stronger. By making the light stronger, it can help build better sensors for things like navigation or finding chemicals. The team used a special shape called a racetrack with smooth curves, which helps keep more light inside instead of letting it escape. They built this device in a very clean room using a machine that writes with electrons to make it super small and precise. This work means future sensors could use less power and work better.
